subject: Re: [junit] Future of testing tools
msgSnippet: Michael, I agree.  Excellent point.  Short and sweet. In the end I m using the helper as an Annotation for communicating that some methods could be private,
messageBody:
Michael,

I agree. Excellent point. Short and sweet.

In the end I'm using the helper as an Annotation
for communicating that some methods
could be private, but I made them public for testing
reasons and for Utility library candidate visibility.

If I could just "Trick" the JVM into thinking that all
methods were public while Unit testing, I'd be just as
happy. Then I would need the test tool to detect or
know which tests are applied to private/procted
members, and exclude those when running tests on the
code as it will ship.

Anyone working on JDK7?

Cheers,
- Ole
